metadata.synopsis: Voss' aftermath after the scene with Raphael and himself.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Find Raphael at the SC upstairs and play through VossScene first. The speak with Voss again. Or use oe RaphaelTango_IntroDone to skip that and get to this dialog immediatelly

4.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
4.text: Follow me to the taproom. We will speak there.

13.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
13.text: I will be waiting beneath the city.

82.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
82.text: Find me when you've taken the Hammer. You will be well-rewarded.

29.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
29.text: Go, talk to Raphael. I'll wait here.

65.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
65.text: Raphael knew how to free Prince Orpheus - and you made him an enemy.

38.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
38.text: My people's freedom is at hand. I can feel it.

52.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
52.text: Tell me, Lae'zel. Tell me you took the devil's deal. Tell me you will free Gith's heir.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: I have the Hammer. I stole it from Raphael's lair.

78.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
78.text: So you lied to me. In spite of all our progress together, still you would abuse my trust.

94.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
94.text: The Hammer... how can it be that you came to possess it... Was it Raphael?

110.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
110.text: So you made the deal with Raphael after all. Fool.

54.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
54.text: So quick to share it with him... this is not wise, Lae'zel.

46.text: So quick to share it with him... this is not wise.

39.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
39.text:
'The Prince of the Comet is not dead.
The Prince of the Comet will come again.
The Prince of the Comet will liberate us from the lich queen's tyranny.'

79.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
79.text: Can it be - will the mighty Prince Orpheus soon illuminate the Astral Plane?

60.speaker: Lae'zel
60.text: Gith's son will soon ride against Vlaakith, Voss. And I will follow him into battle.

75.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
75.text: And you will wield the greatest gift Mother Gith ever granted her dauntless children.
75.context: CinematicNodeContext: Voss leans forward to give player a silver sword, doesn't need to be shown beyond a lean.

109.speaker: Lae'zel
109.text: I will carry it for the honour of Gith, the great liberator - and her unforgotten son.

59.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
59.text: Among the githyanki, one gift is esteemed above all others. The silver sword.

31.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
31.text: Take it. Wield it in honour of Gith, the great liberator - and her unforgotten son.
31.context: CinematicNodeContext: Voss leans forward to give player a silver sword, doesn't need to be shown beyond a lean.

34.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
34.text: Istik, now that you have the Hammer you must find a way to enter the Astral Prism.

47.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
47.text: Once inside, smash Orpheus' bonds. His cry will shake the planes, and I will fly to your aid.

5.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
5.text: The Prince of the Comet will sear the heavens again. Let the lich queen tremble!

137.text: Think again. I will not permit your entry.

114.speaker: Player
114.text: You need to let me into the Prism.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: Is there any way I can convince you?

11.speaker: Player
11.text: I'll find a way to free Orpheus from your clutches.

9.text: Even if you could, you would relinquish your mind to the elder brain in so doing.

101.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
101.text: Questions, istik? You seem to be lost in thought.

96.speaker: Player
96.text: Getting into the Astral Prism will be complicated.

37.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
37.text: Yes. But you will meet this challenge, as you've met so many others.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: Orpheus sensed the tadpole before, and his guard attacked. Won't he attack if we free him?

17.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
17.text: The Prince of the Comet aches for githyanki liberation more than he abhors ghaik.

26.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
26.text: He might seethe when you free him. He might gnash his teeth and slander your name.

127.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
127.text: But he will see reason. I promise you.

53.speaker: Player
53.text: I took the bargain. I will free Orpheus at the first chance.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: I took the bargain. I will free Orpheus at the first chance.

126.speaker: Narrator
126.text: *Lae'zel remains quiet in the face of your lie - but her eyes betray her contempt.*

112.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
112.text: Are my wounds not deep enough, that you would salt them with lies?

18.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
18.text: Orpheus will be free. There is no cost too high to unshackle my people!

80.speaker: Player
80.text: Don't worry. I will find a way to liberate Orpheus.

83.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
83.text: I did not come this far for you to turn your back on the First Mother's son.

120.speaker: Lae'zel
120.text: Gith'ka tavkim krash'ht. You put your trust in me, Voss. I plan to honour it.
120.context: NodeContext: Gith's light guides us. GITH-kah TAHV-kim krasht. (With a bit of guttural edge.)

51.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
51.text: Yes. And it seems I have no choice but to trust. There is but one Prism, and you are its key.

73.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
73.text: And yet it seems I have no choice but to trust. There is but one Prism, and you are its key.

122.speaker: Player
122.text: It's not my cost to pay. Figure it out yourself.

135.speaker: Lae'zel
135.text: What are you playing at? I will find a way yet to free the prince. This was my promise!

128.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
128.text: I thought you'd freed yourself from the lich queen's dead claws. How wrong I was.

16.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
16.text: Yet your companion disagrees, Lae'zel. What am I to make of that?

111.speaker: Player
111.text: Raphael wants a powerful crown in trade. Who knows what chaos he might sow?

30.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
30.text: No more than Vlaakith will sow in Tu'narath and beyond. No more than the ghaik will sow across every plane.

76.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
76.text: There is nothing I won't do, nothing I won't give, to free Orpheus from the Prism. The marks I bear are proof enough of that.

130.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
130.text: But you - you are the one who carries the Astral Prism. You are the one who must free the prince.

117.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
117.text: That Hammer is the only thing capable of smashing the chains that bind the Prince of the Comet.

40.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
40.text: Find a way to retrieve the Hammer and free Orpheus from the Prism.

6.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
6.text: I will assemble his remaining honour guard and plan our next actions.

113.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
113.text: Together, we will yet free The True Heir of Gith's blessed Empire.

123.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
123.text: He will free us from Vlaakith, and lead our kith'raki against the ghaik.

103.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
103.text: Istik - I will wait in the underground. Seek me when you have the Hammer in hand.

118.speaker: Player
118.text: Any idea where Raphael might keep the Orphic Hammer?

132.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
132.text: A devil of Raphael's stature does not simply make camp on the shores of the Styx.

28.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
28.text: He will have made a sanctuary for himself. A lavish one, too, one that caters to his many vices.

92.speaker: Lae'zel
92.text: The House of Hope. We must find a way in.

41.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
41.text: The House of Hope, you say? I couldn't ask for a name more fitting.

67.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
67.text: Every house has an entrance, istik - even those in the Hells. You must find it.

121.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
121.text: He must keep the Orphic Hammer there.

19.speaker: Player
19.text: I'd sooner just kill you instead.

139.text: You are wasting your time and mine. Our true enemy is the elder brain. Focus your mind there.

108.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
108.text: Raphael possesses a powerful relic called the Orphic Hammer.

131.speaker: Player
131.text: It's over, Voss. I'm here for your head.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: Raphael did not offer any bargain.

88.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
88.text: Do you take me for a fool? The devil may speak in poetry, but his purpose was crystal clear.

105.speaker: Player
105.text: I'm not interested in pacting with devils, Voss.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: No. I will find another way to liberate Orpheus.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: I'm here for one reason, Voss: to kill you.

61.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
61.text: Lae'zel of K'liir. Warrior of warriors.

64.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
64.text: Tell me you took the devil's deal. Tell me you will free Gith's heir.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: I changed my mind. I hold the Hammer that will free Orpheus from his chains.

93.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
93.text: Be still and be silent. I'm here for Raphael.
